main event: Two aerial lights of unknown origin were observed over Dayton, Ohio on July 15, 1959.
interesting points: The lights appeared to be pointing upward and were hovering or moving very slowly, without any great speed or abrupt changes in direction.
The lights were golden yellow or amber in color, with little or no change in illumination.
No trail or beam of light was observed.
The sighting lasted for at least 15 minutes, from 3:10 AM to 5:45 AM.
The observer noted that more objects could have been seen, and the moon may have obscured the view.
